job.title: Systems Engineer
job.description:
Job description

The Systems Engineer will be responsible for the oversight and administration of Keycentrix’s IT assets, both hardware and software. This position will provide solution architecture, development and deployment for Keycentrix internal users. The position requires strong troubleshooting and diagnostic skills, the ability to research, design, and implement new solutions from the ground up, as well as strong communication and leadership skills.

Essential Job Responsibilities:

· Develops IT solutions for Keycentrix’s internal customers. Provides IT architecture solutions to meet our critical business needs.

· Administers the installation and operation of all Keycentrix LAN/WAN related network services and security and control measures

· Troubleshoots and resolves LAN/WAN performance, connectivity and related network problems

· Performs installations, upgrades, and support of computer hardware and software for internal customers

· Oversees IT projects ensuring smooth and successful execution

· Collaborates with internal customers and vendors on all projects, timelines and budgets

· Advises and supports all company policies and procedures pertaining to IT administration

· Communicates effectively with all internal customers, ensuring customer satisfaction and strong business relationships.

· Oversees the documentation of all Keycentrix systems and procedures within the scope of IT architecture, installation, support and operations

· Performs any assigned tasks associated with support of external Keycentrix customers as directed

· Trains and may provide work direction to IT Technician(s)

Qualifications:

· Solid technical skills and experience with a variety of network protocols, software, and hardware involved in LAN and WAN operations

· Strong troubleshooting, analytic and diagnostic skills

· IT architecture skills

· Strong project planning skills

· Ability to perform high-level root cause analysis of technical issues

· Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical users

· Self-starter but able to work with and lead/mentor others

· Availability to perform on-call work when necessary

· Excellent communication skills

· Project management experience

· Disaster recovery and planning experience

· Minimum 3 years of experience in at least 7 of the following areas:

· TCP/IP networking

· WAN, LAN, WLAN

· Standard network protocols (HTTP(S), FTP, SMTP, SSL, BGP, EIGRP, etc.)

· VLANs

· VMware virtual server and workstation environments

· Active Directory environments (2012 and above)

· Microsoft Operating Systems (Server and Desktop)

· VPN and remote access methodologies

· Server and desktop hardware installation, configuration, and support skills

· SonicWall firewall and network security experience

· Backup and DR solutions, specifically Veeam

Other Preferred Skills

· CCNA or CCNP certification

· MCSE, MCSA certification

· Network design/architecture experience

· VOIP telephony solutions

· Microsoft Cloud solutions (SharePoint, Office 365)

· SAN, NAS storage solution experience (specifically with Nimble, EqualLogic, NetApp, EMC)

· Experience with network monitoring and performance tuning

· Linux (Ubuntu, Red Hat, CentOS)

· SQL databases (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle)

· Docker, Kubernetes, or other container solutions

Education or Certifications:

· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science desired; or commensurate degree and experience combination

About Keycentrix™

Keycentrix is a software and technology company based in Wichita, Kansas. For over 40 years, we have provided powerful and affordable software that helps Independent Retail and Mail-order Pharmacies thrive. We also provide best-in-class software solutions for Specialty Pharmacies with Newleaf® software, allowing pharmacies to run better, smarter, and faster, while maintaining high-touch care for the communities and patients served. Learn more about our full range of software and IT services at keycentrix.com.

We are proud to announce that we recently won the prestigious 2019 Surescripts White Coat Award™ for e-prescriptions accuracy. https://www.pharmacytimes.com/news/keycentrix-wins-surescripts-2019-white-coat-award-for-prescription-accuracy

Keycentrix is a member of the Cochener Garvey Capital Partners, Inc. family of businesses. www.cgcpi.com.

Keycentrix is committed to providing equal opportunity in employment for all people without regard to the following: race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity, national origin, physical or mental disability, service in the military, or any other attribute or characteristic protected by law.
